issue.title: Proxy release files through worker

repository.name: tauri-update-cloudflare
repository.description: A Tauri update server, hosted as a Cloudflare edge function

issue.body:
## Intent

Enable private Github repos to provide Tauri's updater with the necessary update files. Right now a Github-authenticated worker can get the necessary release information, but the Tauri client can't access the files. 

Security is outside the scope of this issue and depends on updates with Tauri: https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/3896

## Questions / Considerations

- [x] Limitations with workers? Bandwidth, CPU etc.
As far as I can tell, there aren't any [Cloudflare limits](https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/platform/limits/) that affect this use case. 

## Implementation

- [x] Create a route, `/latest/$filename`. This route gets the latest release from the repo, filters assets by file name, requests the file, and feeds the request as the response.
- [x] Change the response to Tauri's updater request from the github file url to the proxied route. We can base this off of a defined GITHUB_SECRET for now, or add an additional flag.

body:
Amazing thank you sm @lucasfernog :sparkles:

Is there any documentation on how to use this?

@ghostdevv add this to your Cargo.toml:

```
[patch.crates-io]
tauri = { git = "https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri" }
tauri-build = { git = "https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri" }
```

You'll need to remove `useBootstrapper` field from your tauri.conf.json as the next release will remove that.

If you're using the Tauri CLI, you need to either build it from source or use Cargo directly.

- Using the Rust CLI it from source

```sh
cargo install --git https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri tauri-cli

cargo tauri dev
cargo tauri build
```

- Using the Node.js CLI from source
```sh
git clone https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri
cd tauri/tooling/cli/node
yarn
yarn build

node /path/to/tauri/tooling/cli/node/tauri.js dev
node /path/to/tauri/tooling/cli/node/tauri.js build
```

- Using Cargo directly

```
cd src-tauri

cargo run --no-default-features # instead of tauri dev
cargo build # instead of tauri build - won't bundle your app though
```

If you're using the Tauri API, you might need to use the next version.

```
git clone https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri
cd tauri/tooling/api
yarn
yarn build
```

- Linking using yarn link:

```
cd dist
yarn link
cd /path/to/your/project
yarn link @tauri-apps/api
```


- Alternatively, you can change your package.json to use the folder as a dependency:

```json
{
  "dependencies": {
    "@tauri-apps/api": "/path/to/tauri/tooling/api/dist"
  }
}
```
